TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit PrintBooleanProperty extends System.Printing.IndexedProperties.PrintProperty

Docs.summary: Represents a property (and its value) of a printing system hardware or software component.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use this class while installing a second printer whose properties differ from an existing printer only in location, port, and shared status.
[!code-csharp[ClonePrinter#ClonePrinter](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ClonePrinter/CSharp/Program.cs#cloneprinter)] [!code-vb[ClonePrinter#ClonePrinter](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ClonePrinter/visualbasic/program.vb#cloneprinter)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string attributeName) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the attribute that the represents.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified attribute.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `attributeName` should be spelled exactly the same as the name of some particular <xref:System.Boolean> property of a print system object, including casing. For example, the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.IsBusy%2A> property of a <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> object must be spelled "IsBusy", not "Busy" or "Isbusy".

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string attributeName, object attributeValue) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the property that the represents.
The value of the property that the represents.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified property that is using the specified value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `attributeName` should be spelled exactly the same as the name of some particular <xref:System.Boolean> property of a print system object, including casing. For example, the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.IsBusy%2A> property of a <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> object must be spelled "IsBusy", not "Busy" or "Isbusy".
## Examples The following example shows how to use this constructor while installing a second printer that differs in its properties from an existing printer only in location, port, and shared status.
[!code-csharp[ClonePrinter#ClonePrinter](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ClonePrinter/CSharp/Program.cs#cloneprinter)] [!code-vb[ClonePrinter#ClonePrinter](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ClonePrinter/visualbasic/program.vb#cloneprinter)]
